page.title: 12POLLUTION IN THE CANAL
page.content: {ECOLOGY EXERIMENT1}-To determine whether the canal was polluted, various experiments were done. Firstly, a sample of water was poured into a long glass tube,which had a cork in the bottom with a cross on it. The object was to pour water into the tube until the cross was invisible. It took 10cm cubed and showed the water was highly polluted. {EXPERIMENT2}-An experiment was done to determine if lead was in the canal. By adding some Potassium Chromate, which is yellow, the water should form a yellow solid if lead is present. This didn't happen. {EXPERIMENT3}-Using Methylene Blue, we could find if Oxygen was present by the water turning blue. This happened proving Oxygen present. {EXPERIMENT4}-We proved Hydrogen Sulphate was present.
